known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Daily Wage Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The current system does not support automatic salary calculation based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll
known_issues.issue_explanation: System shows a greyed-out formula in leave policy that is overridden by the daily wage calculator configured in payroll settings. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for unpaid leave deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculator Leap Year Miscalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate total service period and lower gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: System requires enhancement to automatically recognize and incorporate 366-day years in service period computations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: Daily wage calculation for pro-rated End of Service (EOS) amounts is producing incorrect results due to decimal precision errors. The system consistently calculates amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals. The formula (basic + allowances / 30) appears to be configured correctly, but the final calculation shows systematic undercalculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation affecting pro-rated salary computations.
known_issues.gap_statement: Enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms are needed to ensure exact financial calculations for pro-rated amounts.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation showed slight difference from manual calculation (Bayzat: AED 231,821.10, Manual: AED 252,485). Support confirmed system calculation follows specific service duration and daily wage formula.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation involves complex rules with different rates for service periods (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year after 5 years)
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential complexity in handling partial years and service duration splits in gratuity calculations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (specifically February 29th), causing minor differences in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation showed 913 days by including the leap day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Methodology Nuances
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years, especially for service periods above 5 years. The system uses different calculation approaches for completed and incomplete years, including special handling for leap years by using 366 as a divisor when appropriate.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Calculation logic is not transparently communicated, leading to potential misunderstandings about how partial years and leap years are processed.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples of service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Days Worked Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates total job tenure with a potential extra day (622 vs 623 days), causing minor variations in gratuity calculation. The platform adds one extra day during length of service duration computation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Slight discrepancy in days worked calculation method

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on policy configuration, which may differ from user expectations about calendar days. The daily wage calculation follows a fixed policy setting that might not align with user understanding of prorated calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations, which may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly working days affect daily wage calculations, causing variations in leave salary accrual reports
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using different daily wage configurations with independent divisors (30 days vs 30.42 days), causing calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use separate daily wage calculation methods that cannot be automatically aligned.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of a unified daily wage calculation method that consistently applies across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Salary Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends on work week configuration, which may not be immediately obvious to users

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. Proration works correctly for past departure dates but not for future dates.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculator lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Product lacks dynamic proration handling for varying payroll processing and departure date scenarios

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions on Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for module communication enhancement to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations. This can result in deduction amounts that exceed the expected monthly salary.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses a non-standard divisor that may not align with user expectations
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in February remarks for unpaid leave deduction, despite having accurate backend calculation. This creates potential user confusion about daily rate calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on actual month days.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy calculations. This can result in unpaid leave deductions being calculated using gross salary instead of basic salary, contrary to policy-level configurations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy prevents users from customizing leave deduction calculations at the policy level

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display does not reflect the leave occurrence month's rate
known_issues.gap_statement: Need a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at the time of leave request

limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days divided by 12 months.
limitations.impact: Requires manual adjustments for variations in actual worked days

limitations.title: Ambiguity in Departure Date Counting

operational_reality_facts.fact_title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll

operational_reality_facts.fact_title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
